title: UPDATE - ReFi Spring Season 2 Grants and ReFi DAO Local Node Prize
html:
Hey there! 👋

Marcelo and Anna of ReFi Spring and ReFi DAO here with some great news on the event grants covering ReFi Spring Season 2 events and ReFi DAO Local Node Prize applications.

In this article, we will cover the following topics:

  • Update on ReFi Spring Season 2 Grants
  • Next steps for ReFi DAO Local Node Prize Applications
  • What’s coming next for the Event Organizers’ Guild

Let’s go! 🚀

ReFi Spring Season 2 Grants

We are super excited to announce that we’ve allocated the first batch of the ReFi Spring Season 2 grants and we’d like to celebrate all the amazing event organizers! 👏 Read till the end to discover which event organizers where selected in the last batch of funding.

Tereza Bizkova - Medellin, Colombia 🇨🇴

During "Blockchain for Good? Medellín, meet ReFi!", Tereza Bizkova introduced ReFi and delved into particular blockchain applications for the first time in Medellín, Colombia. She achieved her goal of promoting and raising awareness about ReFi while highlighting its potential benefits for social good. Find out more about her successful event below! 👇

💰 Grant received: $650
🔗 See transaction:

Timothy Goudzand - Paramaribo, Suriname 🇸🇷

Timothy Goudzand, founder of  Infinitri, is planning another exciting event - "Innovators Buzz", aimed at bringing together innovative thinkers in web3. The primary objective of this event, which is being organized for the second time, is to foster connections among web 3 enthusiasts and encourage them to envision a sustainable and resilient future for Suriname.

💰 Grant received: $1250
🔗 See transaction:

Cyrille Frank Teukam - Douala, Cameroon 🇨🇲

Cyrille Frank Teukam is returning with the "Cameroon ReFi Talk Series" to establish connections between ReFi-related initiatives and promote their impact through collaboration.

💰 Grant received: $1250

Kuzy Muvezwa - Harare, Zimbabwe 🇿🇼

Kuzy Muvezwa from BuiltDifferent organizing "ReFi 101" – an event intended to gather individuals interested in Web 3, as well as developers, enthusiasts, and founders who are eager to learn and incorporate ReFi technology in Africa. This event is a fantastic opportunity to gain valuable insights and make significant strides towards the future of ReFi technology, while contributing to the development of the ecosystem.

💰 Grant received: $1250

Make sure to keep up with Shawn from IXO as he leads the way in ReFi innovation at "ReFi Autumn Cape Town 2023" in South Africa. The event is designed to spark discussions on Web3 and ReFi among unemployed youth by uniting a coalition of organizations.

Felix Fritsch - Reichenau an der Rax, Austria 🇦🇹

The second edition of Solarpunk Now! organized by Felix Fritsch at the Crypto Commons Hub has been an absolute success. Featuring agricultural IoT initiatives, permaculture training sessions, solarpunk art and design, all with a focus on ReFi, the event has fostered deep connections between the participants. Make sure to check out how it went! 👇

💰 Grant received: $1250

Adaeze Okafor - Lagos, Nigeria 🇳🇬

Adaeze is a passionate leader from ReFi by South, who is currently at the forefront of organizing the impactful event, "Educating Nigeria Women in Climate and Web 3". The event will focus on crucial topics such as extreme weather conditions, climate adaptation policies, and bridging the gender-based digital divide.

💰 Grant received: $1250

Susanne Zapelão & Shauna Butterly - Lisboa, Portugal 🇵🇹

ReFi Lisboa has been organizing regular monthly events to gather the ReFi community and build strong relationships between people sharing the mission of  regeneration. Congratulations to Susanne Zapelão & Shauna Butterly for the wonderful organization! Check out the pictures of the latest ReFi Day event!

💰 Grant received: $1250

Kennedy Ng'ang'a - Nairobi, Kenya 🇰🇪

Shamba Network, a startup led by Kennedy Ng'ang'a is working to building measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) tools accessible to small farmers. Adter the successful gathering of last year, Kennedy is organizing the second edition of ReFi Kenya. The event will introduce local farmers to ReFi principles and foster the development of projects on the ground.

💰 Grant received: $1250

Wrapping up ReFi Spring Season 2 Grants!

We are excited to announce the last batch of grantees that will be receiving support for ReFi Spring Season 2 Event Grants! We have received over 70 applications, and we are incredibly grateful to have the chance to support the ReFi movement through IRL events.

Karla Córdoba-Brenes - Costa Rica 🇨🇷

Verano ReFi Costa Rica 2023 will bring ReFi to the rural areas first, prioritizing events organized by CofiBlocks and Verdes in Poás de Alajuela and Monteverde. These regions traditionally experience a lack of educational opportunities, especially those related to technology, impact and innovation. There will also digital events focused on women and organized by Ruta Ruda, with the aim to create new opportunities for women to free themselves from workplace harassment by learning web3 tools and co-creating ReFi-inspired collaborative businesses.

💰 Grant received: $1250

Machuche Simalike - Tanzania 🇹🇿

Through the Rangi Chanya event community members will be able to be onboarded to web 3 discover different opportunities for them to not only earn a living but also simultaneously take part in impacting their community positively. But also through the dApp they will get a chance to add value to their impact and personal lives through incentives (such as the plastic credits) and have more power to run their lives.

Javier Delgado - Margarita, Venezuela (TBD) 🇻🇪

Javier Delgado (https://twitter.com/polkajavier1) of Vostadg (twitter.com/vostadg) will be creating partnerships with indigenous communities, women's groups, LGBTIQ+ community and other minorities. We will have a live sign language translator, we will also include public schools and high schools as well as community brigades, housewives and the general public, our event is meant to be inclusive at all times.

ReFi DAO Local Nodes Prize - What’s coming next?

First of all, thank you for applying to become a ReFi DAO Local node. We are incredibly grateful to receive your application. Our team is currently reviewing all the applications as they come in. To make it easier for you to know the status of your application to become a ReFi DAO Local Node, we have created this public document in Notion

BUTTON: CHECK THE STATUS OF YOUR APPLICATIONReFi DAO Local Node Prize (public)*

Here's what you can expect:

  • Our team is reviewing applications with a number of external advisors before assessing eligibility.
  • If you are eligible and have a strong application, we will invite you to create a Gitcoin grant to raise funds for your emerging Local Node under the upcoming Beta round with full support from the ReFi DAO and Commons Stack community.
  • If you are eligible but your application needs work, we will recommend next steps, such as meeting with other founders, going deeper into local problems, and building local partnerships.
  • If you are not eligible, we will explain exactly what you need to do to meet the criteria as outlined in our announcement. LINK THE MIRROR HERE

Next Steps for the ReFi DAO Local Node Prize

If you have applied for the ReFi DAO Local Node Prize, be sure to attend the upcoming AMA on LinkedIN on Wednesday, April 12 at 4 pm London time. This is an excellent opportunity to learn more about the prize and ask any questions you may have.

What’s coming next for the Event Organizers’ Guild?

Rewrite and put emphasis on the last event!!!!!!

Last week we had a full house at the Event Organizers' Guild as have John Ellison of ReFi DAO gave a training on how to successfully fundraise Gitcoin.

The engaging training covered the main aspects on how to write and present a grant, how to run a promotional campaign and the importance of building a strong community.

Next week we will have the last session at the Guild, to reflect on what we learned and collect feedback for future trainings coming up later this year.
